page.title: 10Heathland
page.content:
Heathland is rapidly declining and there is not much left. On lowland heath there are no natural trees at all. There might not be any heathland left by the year 2000.
The biggest threats to heathland are the{ploughing and planting}of the farmer and forester. Also, motor-cycle scrambling, horse riding, fire and invasion by pine and birch scrub and bracken.
If all the heath disappears, lots of {insects and plants will lose their {habitat}and may become extinct from England. The main plants on lowland heath are heather and gorse. Heath is mainly boggy land with lots of frogs, toads, adders and dragonflies.
